schema.title: Tutor messages
schema.description: Select which kind of menu and control help to announce
enumLabels: Turn off menu and control help

schema.title: Access Key
schema.description: Select which access keys to speak

schema.title: Confirm when Exiting JAWS
schema.description: Whether or not to present a confirmation menu when exiting JAWS.

schema.title: Automatic Updates Notifications
schema.description: Whether or not to present automatic notifications about JAWS updates.

schema.title: View Mode
schema.description: Select whether to run JAWS from the system tray or not.

schema.title: Virtual Viewer
schema.description: Enable or disable showing the 'Virtual Viewer' on the screen.

schema.title: Keyboard Type
schema.description: Set the keyboard type being used.

schema.title: Pointer Shadow
schema.description: Disable Pointer Shadow.

schema.title: Personalized Menus
schema.description: Disable Personalized Menus.

schema.title: Language Bar
schema.description: Disable Language Bar.

schema.title: Typing echo
schema.description: How to announce typed words and/or characters.

schema.title: Screen Echo
schema.description: Specifies how much text is read when information on the screen changes.

schema.title: Typing Interrupt
schema.description: Whether to stop speaking when the user types.

schema.title: Insert Key Mode
schema.description: The operating mode of the insert key.

schema.title: Key Repeat
schema.description: Whether or not to allow repeated keys.  Repeated keys are allowed by default.

schema.title: Lower Audio Volume of Programs while JAWS Speaks
schema.description: Whether to lower the volume of programs other than JAWS when speaking.

schema.title: Web Verbosity Level
schema.description: Verbosity level used for reading Web pages, HTML files and PDF files.

schema.title: Read Web Pages Automatically When Loaded
schema.description: Whether to automatically read web pages when they're first loaded.

schema.title: Skip Past Repeated Text
schema.description: Whether to position the Virtual Cursor on the first line which is different than the previous page whenever a new page is displayed.

schema.title: Expand Abbreviations
schema.description: Whether or not to expand abbreviations (using the abbr tag).

schema.title: Expand Acronyms
schema.description: Whether or not to expand acronyms (using the acronym tag).

schema.title: Speak Access Keys Within Web Page
schema.description: Whether to announce HTML element access keys when reading a web page.

schema.title: Smart Navigation
schema.description: Whether to enable "smart navigation" when reading web pages.

schema.title: Document Presentation Mode
schema.description: The presentation mode used for document reading.

schema.title: Screen Follows Virtual Cursor
schema.description: Whether the screen should automatically scroll to display the line on which the Virtual Cursor is positioned.

schema.title: Wrap Navigation
schema.description: Whether or not to allow navigation keystrokes such as tab and shift tab to wrap to the top or bottom of the document.

schema.title: Include Graphics
schema.description: Whether/when to include graphics in web pages.

schema.title: Graphic Rendering Option
schema.description: Select what to speak for an image.
enumLabels: The first attribute found in the order list

schema.title: Custom Graphic Attrs
schema.description: Specify the order in which attributes of an image should be searched.

schema.title: Graphical Link Last Resort
schema.description: What to announce when a graphical link contains no title or alt text for its enclosing image and the enclosing anchor has no title.

schema.title: Filter Consecutive Duplicate Links
schema.description: Whether to skip (not announce) consecutive duplicate links.

schema.title: Identify Link Type
schema.description: Whether to distinguish the various types of links e.g. "FTP link", "mailto link" versus simply announcing "link" for all types of links.

schema.title: Identify Same Page Links
schema.description: Whether to identify links that point to other places on the current page by saying "same page link".

schema.title: Include Image Links
schema.description: Specify how to speak image links.

schema.title: Identify Image Map Links
schema.description: Specify how to speak "Image Map Links".

schema.title: Heading Navigation using 1-6
schema.description: Specify how heading navigation should work when using keys 1-6.
enumLabels: Speak Ancestor Headings when Jumping to a New Section
Play Sound when Jumping to a New Section

schema.title: Indicate Headings
schema.description: Specify which headings should be announced.

schema.title: Ignore Inline Frames
schema.description: Whether to ignore inline frames, such as those used for advertising.

schema.title: Indicate ColSpan
schema.description: Whether to announce column spans when reading table data in web pages.

schema.title: Table Detection
schema.description: Whether to announce all tables, or only data tables.

schema.title: Table Presentation Information
schema.description: Which tables to read as tables (data tables, or all tables).

schema.title: Enable Edge
schema.description: Whether JAWS should provide popular JAWS browser features in Edge such as Virtual Cursor, Navigation Quick Keys, List of Objects, and many more.

schema.title: Embedded ActiveX Support
schema.description: Whether or not to support embedded ActiveX controls such as Macromedia Flash Movies. If enabled, only objects defined in JActiveX.ini are affected by this setting.

schema.title: Form Field Prompt Options
schema.description: Which attributes to prefer when describing form fields.
enumLabels: Both Label and Title if different
Both Label and Alt if different

schema.title: Link Activation
schema.description: How to activate a link when the enter key is pressed. Either simulates a mouse click or passes along the enter keypress.

schema.title: Button Text Options
schema.description: Indicate which elements from a Button speak.
enumLabels: The first attribute found in the order list

schema.title: Indicate Element Attributes
schema.description: Whether to announce any HTML attributes defined in the "HTML Attributes Behavior" map of the current scheme.

schema.title: Allow Webapp-reserved Keystrokes
schema.description: When both JAWS and a website such as Facebook support a key shortcut, whether to handle the key in JAWS (the default) or pass the key to the web app.

schema.title: Forms Mode
schema.description: Selects the form mode for input information in HTML.

schema.title: Navigation Quick Key Delay
schema.description: Selects the delay to be used with the quick navigation key.

schema.title: Forms Mode Auto Off
schema.description: Disable Forms Mode when a New page loads.

schema.title: Forms Sound Indication
schema.description: Enables forms indication using sounds.

schema.title: Entering Forms Sound
schema.description: Sets the sound to be played when entering a form.

schema.title: Exiting Forms Sound
schema.description: Sets the sound to be played when exiting a form.

schema.title: Filter Repeated Characters
schema.description: Determines how repeated characters are handled.

schema.title: Repetitions
schema.description: Whether or not to count repeated characters.

schema.title: Indicate Caps
schema.description: When to indicate the presence of capital letters.
enumLabels: Read By Line, Word, Char, Spell

schema.title: List Item
schema.description: Use this list to determine how JAWS describes list box items. Select "Say None" to silence reading of list box descriptions. When you select "Say Selected", JAWS only tells you when list box items are selected. When you select the "Say Not Selected" item, JAWS only tells you when list box items are not selected. This is the default setting. If you select "Say Both", JAWS tells you when list box items are selected, and when they are not selected.

schema.title: Spell Alphanumeric Data
schema.description: How to read alphanumeric data.

schema.title: Spell Phonetic Always
schema.description: How to announce word spellings.

schema.title: Announce Phonetic Character after Pause
schema.description: Whether pausing on character will cause JAWS to speak it phonetically while navigating text by character.
enumLabels: After a one and a half second pause

schema.title: Smart Word Reading
schema.description: Whether or not to enable "smart reading" when using the "Say Word" command.

schema.title: Mixed Case processing
schema.description: Whether to announce words with embedded capital letters (such as "MixedCase") as separate words.

schema.title: Dictionary
schema.description: Whether words, phrases, abbreviations, or symbols should be processed through a global or application specific dictionary to determine proper pronunciation. This is enabled by default.

schema.title: Language Detection
schema.description: Whether to enable automatic Language detection.

schema.title: Generalize Dialect
schema.description: Whether to switch languages when encountering content with the same underlying base language.

schema.title: Detect Keyboard Languages
schema.description: Whether to detect the language used by the keyboard.

schema.title: Enhanced Edit Support
schema.description: Whether to activate or deactivate enhanced edit support.

schema.title: Say Selected First
schema.description: Whether to announce the selected text first.

schema.title: Say Window Type First
schema.description: Whether to announce the type of window before announcing the window title/text.

schema.title: Say State First
schema.description: Whether to announce the window state before title/text.

schema.title: Indentation
schema.description: Whether or not to announce indentation.

schema.title: Say Numeric Dates
schema.description: How to announce numeric dates. With no translation, dates are read as numbers. With some translation, dd-mm-yy values are read as text. With extended translation, both dd-mm-yy and dd-mm values are read as text.

schema.title: Numbers
schema.description: How to announce numbers.

schema.title: Single Digit Threshold
schema.description: The number of digits a number must contain before it is read as single digits (like a phone number). Defaults to five.

schema.title: Numbers Containing Dashes as Digits
schema.description: Whether to read numbers that contain dashes (such as phone numbers) as a series of digits.

schema.title: Say Dollars
schema.description: Whether to announce currency symbols.

schema.title: Speak Spelling Error Count
schema.description: Wether to speak spelling error count.
enumLabels: Speak Spelling Error Count and Speak Grammar /Proofing Error Count

schema.title: Context Selection Flags
schema.description: Select the context flags for detection of spelling/grammar errors.

schema.title: Indicate Mistyped Words
schema.description: Whether to indicate a mistyped word.

schema.title: Apply options during SayAll
schema.description: Apply spelling options for errors during SayAll.

schema.title: Underline Spelling and Grammar errors
schema.description: Underline Speeling Errors and/or Underline Grammatical and advanced proofing errors.
enumLabels: Underline Grammatical and advanced proofing errors
Underline Spelling Errors and Underline Grammatical and advanced proofing errors

schema.title: Verbosity
schema.description: How verbose announcements should be.

schema.title: Speech Mode
schema.description: The "speech mode" to use, either "Full" or "Less".

schema.title: Less Speech Options
schema.description: How to behave when in "Less Speech Mode".

schema.title: Scheme
schema.description: Whether or not to intercept CreateDIBSection Note that this value is only read once per JAWS session at startup thus changing this value while JAWS is running has no effect.

schema.title: "Say All" Mode
schema.description: Sets the amount of text which "Say All" sends to the synthesizer as a single unit.

schema.title: Line Pauses
schema.description: Whether to pause at end of a line.

schema.title: Say Blank Line Count
schema.description: In "Say All" mode, whether to announce the number of blank lines.

schema.title: "Say All" Announces Capitals
schema.description: In "Say All" mode, announce an initial capital letter or capitalized word.

schema.title: "Say All" Ignores Shift Keys
schema.description: Allows sticky keys to be used, i.e.: ignores shift keys during SayAll. User can use left/right arrow to do same functions.

schema.title: Announce Special Symbols
schema.description: Select where to announce special symbols.

schema.title: Speak Character Value In Hex
schema.description: Whether to announce the hex value of a character when numpad 5 is pressed three times quickly.

schema.title: Speak Character Value As Sequence of Multibyte Values
schema.description: Whether to read unicode characters as a series of multi-byte values.

schema.title: Include Graphics
schema.description: Which graphics to announce.

schema.title: Minimum Recognition Height
schema.description: Set the minimum recognition height.

schema.title: Minimum Recognition width
schema.description: Set the minimum recognition width.

schema.title: Maximum Recognition width
schema.description: Set the maximum recognition width.

schema.title: Maximum Recognition width
schema.description: Set the maximum recognition width.

schema.title: Translate to language
schema.description: Output language to be translated into.

schema.title: Translate to braille
schema.description: Input language to be translated.

schema.title: Expand current word
schema.description: Show current word in Computer Braille.

schema.title: Suppress Capital Signs
schema.description: Supress capital signs in braille.

schema.title: All Dots Braille Cursor
schema.description: Whether to display the braille cursor as all dots raised instead of showing it using only dots seven and eight.

schema.title: AutoPan Mode
schema.description: The "Auto Pan" algorithm to use.

schema.title: Braille Pan Mode
schema.description: The pan mode algorithm to use.

schema.title: Auto Advance Maximum Interval
schema.description: The maximum advance interval to use.

schema.title: Braille Presentation and Panning
schema.description: Select presentation and panning mode.
enumLabels: Use DOM except in edit controls.
Use DOM except when away from focus

schema.title: Reverse Panning Buttons
schema.description: Whether or not panning buttons are reversed.

schema.title: Autodetect Bluetooth Braille Display
schema.description: Whether to automatically detect bluetooth displays.

schema.title: Braille Cursor Active Cursor
schema.description: Braille cursor follows Active Cursor.

schema.title: Braille Mode
schema.description: Use this option to control the format of the information sent to the braille display. When Line mode is selected, JAWS sends the line of text at the current cursor position to the braille display. When Structured mode is selected, JAWS sends information to the display that is relevant to the current cursor position. The information sent includes things such as control type, dialog name, or number of items in a list. When Speech Output mode is selected, JAWS sends the same text to the display that it sends to the synthesizer.

schema.title: Braille display cursor
schema.description: Active cursor follows Braille display.

schema.title: Enable Braille Sleep Mode
schema.description: Whether to turn off the braille driver, typically used to disable braille for a specific application.

schema.title: Braille Dots
schema.description: The number of braille dots (six or eight) to use.

schema.title: Enable Word Wrap
schema.description: Whether or not to allow words to be split in order to maximize the use of the braille display. Ignored if panning is set to fixed increment.

schema.title: Braille Marking
schema.description: Show Marking may be any combination of the following ored together brlMarkNothing= 0, brlMarkText = 1, brlMarkBold = 2, brlMarkItalic = 4, brlMarkUnderline = 8, brlMarkStrikeout = 16, brlMarkGraphic = 32, brlMarkHighlight = 64, brlMarkColor= 128, // see brlOptColorsToMark string option brlMarkExtended=256, // things like spelling and grammatical errors in MSWord etc, script defined marking brlMarkDoubleStrikeout=512, brlMarkSuperscript=1024, brlMarkSubscript=2048, brlMarkShadow=4096, brlMarkOutline=8192, brlMarkEmboss=16384, brlMarkEngrave=32768, Note when Extended marking is on, JAWS calls the PointNeedsMarking function passing in the coordinates of each cell to determine whether text at that location requires marking. This is useful when the attribute you want to mark is not actually known to JAWS such as the red and green zigzags in MSWord indicating spelling or grammatical errors.

schema.title: Attribute Rotation Delay
schema.description: When in Attribute Mode and characters have multiple attributes, determines how long each attribute should be shown for. This value is in Milliseconds.

schema.title: Filter Control Characters
schema.description: Whether or not to filter certain control characters (currently newlines, linefeeds and tabs).

schema.title: Generalize Bullets
schema.description: Whether to treat all bullets the same.

schema.title: Braille Key Interrupt Speech
schema.description: Whether to Interrupt speech if a keystroke in the Braille display is pressed.

schema.title: Enable Flash Messages
schema.description: Whether or not to show Flash Messages on a braille display.

schema.title: App start messages
schema.description: Enable messaging application starts with different levels of verbosity.

schema.title: Error messages
schema.description: Enable messaging errors with different levels of verbosity.

schema.title: Help messages
schema.description: Enable help messages with different levels of verbosity.

schema.title: Error messages
schema.description: Enable messaging errors with different levels of verbosity.

schema.title: JAWS messages
schema.description: Enable JAWS messages with different levels of verbosity.

schema.title: Mouse echo messages
schema.description: Enable mouse echo messages with different levels of verbosity.

schema.title: Status messages
schema.description: Enable status messages with different levels of verbosity.

schema.title: Smart help messages
schema.description: Enable start smart help messages with different levels of verbosity.

schema.title: Toasts messages
schema.description: Enable messaging Toasts with different levels of verbosity.

schema.title: Tool Tips messages
schema.description: Enable messaging Tool Tips with different levels of verbosity.

schema.title: Tutor messages
schema.description: Enable messaging Tutors with different levels of verbosity.

schema.title: User requested information messages
schema.description: Enable messaging user requested information with different levels of verbosity.

schema.title: Align To Structured Segment
schema.description: Align output to structured segment.

schema.title: Reverse Order of Structured Data
schema.description: Whether to reverse the order of the structured data to show the focused control's info first, followed by its grouping information, and then the dialog box information. By default, items are read in the opposite order.

schema.title: Placement of Status Cells
schema.description: Selects the placement of the status cells in the braille display.

schema.title: Dot firmness
schema.description: Selects the firmness of the dots in the braille display.

schema.title: Grade 2 Translator
schema.description: Selects the translator to be used.

schema.title: Enable Flash Message Prefixes
schema.description: If a display has no Status Cells, whether or not to prepend the Message Prefix to the Flash Message.

schema.title: Message Status Text
schema.description: The text to show in the status area of the display when a Flash message is being shown if the display has no status cells, the text will be prepended to the Flash message.

schema.title: Use Screen Model for Braille in Rich Edits
schema.description: Whether to use the screen model when providing field prompts and text in Braille with rich edits.

schema.title: Say Cursor Shape Change
schema.description: Whether to announce a change in the shape of the cursor.

schema.title: Simultaneous Synth and Wave
schema.description: Whether to enable smoother playing of WAV files when using the DEC Talk Access 32 software synthesizer. This option is only available in Default.jcf. Changes to this setting take effect the next time you start JAWS.  Disabled by default.

schema.title: Quick Key Navigation Mode
schema.description: Navigation Quick Keys let you move through Web pages with easy to remember commands, such as T for table, F for form field, N for non link text, and V for visited link. These commands are only available when the Virtual Cursor is active. Use these radio buttons to set Navigation Quick Keys off, on, or on only during Say All reading. The default is on.

schema.title: JAWS Insert Key
schema.description: Whether/which insert keys can be used as a JAWS Insert.
enumLabels: Use both Numpad and Extended Inserted

schema.title: Initial State of NumLock Key
schema.description: The initial state of the NumLock key.

schema.title: Use Extended Keys
schema.description: Whether to distinguish between extended and number pad keys.
enumLabels: Treat Extended and Numpad keys the same
Differentiate between Extended and Numpad keys

schema.title: Generalize Modifiers
schema.description: Differentiate Between Left and Right Paired Keys.
enumLabels: Treat Extended and Numpad keys the same
Differentiate between Extended and Numpad keys

schema.title: Allow On Screen Keyboards
schema.description: Whether to allow on screen keyboards.

schema.title: Touch Typing Mode
schema.description: Which keyboard mode to use for the touch keyboard.

schema.title: Touch Typing Echo
schema.description: Whether/how to echo text entered using the touch keyboard.

schema.title: Touch Keyboard Notification
schema.description: Whether/how to notify when the touch keyboard appears/disappears.

schema.title: Touch Alternative Character Panel Popup Notification
schema.description: How to announce the appearance of a panel of alternate keys in the touch keyboard.

schema.title: Text Analyser
schema.description: Indicates text analyzer behavior.

schema.title: Explore Delay
schema.description: Sets the maximum duration of a user's screen touch that will be considered as a 'tap'

schema.title: Double Tab Speed
schema.description: Sets the time interval between individual taps in a double or triple tap.

schema.title: Tap Radius
schema.description: Sets the size of the finger contact spot on the touch screen.

schema.title: Flick Velocity
schema.description: Sets the minimum finger velocity on the touch screen above which the movement is recognized as a flick.

schema.title: Enable Mouse Echo
schema.description: Whether or not to enable the mouse echo, i.e. reading content under the mouse pointer.

schema.title: Mouse Echo Interrupt
schema.description: Whether to stop speaking when the mouse is moved.

schema.title: Mouse Echo Instant
schema.description: Enable text reading while the mouse is in motion so you do not have to pause to hear the text under the mouse.

schema.title: Mouse Echo Delay
schema.description: How long to delay announcing content under the mouse, in milliseconds. Defaults to 0 (no delay).

schema.title: Mouse Echo Unit
schema.description: The unit of text to announce when the mouse pauses over text in a control.  Defaults to reading the whole line.

schema.title: Speak Description of Item
schema.description: Whether to speak the description of an item on mouseover.

schema.title: Speak Control Type and State of Item
schema.description: Whether to speak the type of control and state of item when mousing over a control.

schema.title: Use Virtual PC Cursor
schema.description: Whether to use the virtual PC cursor when reading HTML documents.

schema.title: Use Virtual Ribbon Menu
schema.description: Whether to turn on the virtual ribbon menu.

schema.title: Highlight Touch Cursor
schema.description: Whether or not to highlight selected items when using the touch cursor or touch gestures.

schema.title: Visual Tracking Color
schema.description: The colour to use when highlighting items selected using the touch cursor.

schema.title: Visual Tracking Style
schema.description: The style of highlighting to use.

schema.title: Visual Tracking Transparency
schema.description: How transparent to make the visual highlighting of selected items.

schema.title: Visual Tracking Thickness
schema.description: How thick to make the "box" and "underline" highlighting styles.

schema.title: Visual Tracking Spacing
schema.description: The amount of spacing between the highlight box and the highlighted item.

schema.title: Search for Prompts
schema.description: Determine to what extent JAWS searches for prompts.

schema.title: Use Accessibility Driver for Screen Capture
schema.description: Whether to use the legacy accessibility driver.

schema.title: Virtual Ribbon Support
schema.description: Whether to use the Virtual PC cursor to read HTML documents. When using the Virtual PC cursor, Web pages and other HTML documents are read as if they were formatted into single columns, with each link or form field on a line of its own.  This mode allows you to navigate or select text in a Web page as if you were in a standard text document, while also giving you the ability to fill out forms or activate links.

schema.title: Virtual PC Cursor
schema.description: Whether to use the virtual PC cursor when reading HTML documents.

schema.title: Announce Multiline Edit Controls
schema.description: Whether to announce multi-line edit controls.

schema.title: Track Focus Rectangle
schema.description: Set to one causes MAGic to track the focus rectangle in standard controls that utilize focus rectangles.

schema.title: FSCast Notifications
schema.description: Whether to have JAWS display a dialog when new podcasts from Freedom Scientific are available.

schema.title: Graphics Mode
schema.description: How to handle graphic CRC values.
enumLabels: Store graphic CRC values when the graphics are being drawn to the screen.
Compute them from the screen image at the time they are requested to be spoken.

schema.title: Ignore Set Sys Modal
schema.description: Whether to disallow Windows calling the SetSysModalWindow function. In most cases this is desirable, because System Modal Windows cannot be spoken.

schema.title: Include Lines
schema.description: Whether to include line segments in the Off Screen Model. This is required for Excel and other programs which draw a focus rectangle.

schema.title: Speak Sys Modal Message Box
schema.description: Whether to announce System Modal Message Boxes.

schema.title: Track Command Bars
schema.description: Whether to track the menu bar in Office applications.

schema.title: Trim Braille Graphic Labels
schema.description: Whether to trim the size of a braille graphic. Useful to preserve the virtical positioning of braille text.

schema.title: Active Voice Profile Name
schema.description: The active voice profile.

schema.title: Abbreviations
schema.description: Whether to expand abbreviations.  If this is enabled, abbreviations with a title attribute will have their title read instead of the on screen text.

schema.title: Acronyms
schema.description: If this is enabled, acronyms with a title attribute will have their title read instead of the on screen text.

schema.title: Block Quote Indication
schema.description: Whether to indicate HTML block quotations.

schema.title: Forms Mode Auto Off
schema.description: Whether or not Forms Mode should be automatically turned off when the current page is updated.

schema.title: List Indication
schema.description: Whether to announce lists with the item count and nesting level.

schema.title: Use Legacy IE Support
schema.description: Whether or not to use legacy IE support instead of the default FS Dom Server support.

schema.title: AllCapsIndicator
schema.description: The text to read before text that appears in all capital letters.

schema.title: Cap Indicator
schema.description: The text to read before a capital letter.

schema.title: Case
schema.description: Whether to indicate the case of spoken text with a change of inflection.

schema.title: Indicate Attributes on Dialogs and Menus
schema.description: Whether to announce attributes in dialogs and menus if the scheme allows for it.

schema.title: JAWS Punctuation Enabled
schema.description: Which punctuation marks to speak.

schema.title: Left Shift Skip Back
schema.description: How the shift keys should behave in "Say All" mode.
enumLabels: during SayAll, right shift will skip back and left shift will skip forward
during SayAll, left shift will skip back and right shift will skip forward

schema.title: Migration Wizard Displayed
schema.description: Whether or not to display the migration wizard on startup.

schema.title: Process Tooltip Event
schema.description: Whether or not to process tooltip events.

schema.title: Reading Interrupt
schema.description: Whether to interrupt speech when a key that is bound to a macro is pressed.

schema.title: Skim Reading Indication
schema.description: Whether or not to indicate (via a beep) when skimming over text units for which the regular expression returns FALSE.

schema.title: Skip ILM
schema.description: Whether to show the licensing manager on startup when running in 40-minute evaluation mode.
enumLabels: display the license manager on startup
do not display the license manager on startup

schema.title: Enable Speech History
schema.description: Whether to read through the 50-item speech history when "insert+spacebar" and then "h" are pressed.

schema.title: Synthesizer
schema.description: The synthesizer to use/ Available synthesizers are listed in JfW.INI

schema.title: Tether Jaws to PC
schema.description: Whether or not to tether the JAWS cursor to the PC cursor.  If this is set to 'on', whenever the Pc cursor moves, the Jaws cursor will follow it. If this is set to 'off', the JAWS cursor is indifferent to PC cursor movements (this is the default).

schema.title: Use Virtual Info in Forms Mode
schema.description: Whether to use information from the virtual HTML area for prompts in Forms mode. Warning: this will not always result in accurate information, particularly on pages where there are errors in the HTML coding which result in forms mode and virtual mode being out of synchronization.

schema.title: Primary synthesizer
schema.description: The synthesizer to use for the voice profile.

schema.title: Primary language
schema.description: The primary language used for the voice profile.

schema.title: Parent config
schema.description: The parent config from which to inherit.

schema.title: Pitch
schema.description: The pitch to use for all types of announcements.

schema.title: Punctuation
schema.description: How much punctuation to announce for all types of announcements.

schema.title: The spell rate delta
schema.description: The ammount speech rates decresases when spelling words or lines.

schema.title: Synth Language
schema.description: The language to use for all announcements.

schema.title: Uppercase pitch delta
schema.description: Pitch variation as you type or arrow accross capital letters.

schema.title: Global Volume
schema.description: The volume for all announcements.

schema.title: Global voice name
schema.description: The voice name to use by default.

schema.title: Parent config
schema.description: The parent config from which to inherit.

schema.title: Pitch
schema.description: The pitch to use for all types of announcements.

schema.title: Punctuation
schema.description: How much punctuation to announce for all types of announcements.

schema.title: The spell rate delta
schema.description: The ammount speech rates decresases when spelling words or lines.

schema.title: Synth Language
schema.description: The language to use for all announcements.

schema.title: Uppercase pitch delta
schema.description: Pitch variation as you type or arrow accross capital letters.

schema.title: Global Volume
schema.description: The volume for all announcements.

schema.title: Global voice name
schema.description: The voice name to use by default.

schema.title: Parent config
schema.description: The parent config from which to inherit.

schema.title: Pitch
schema.description: The pitch to use for all types of announcements.

schema.title: Punctuation
schema.description: How much punctuation to announce for all types of announcements.

schema.title: The spell rate delta
schema.description: The ammount speech rates decresases when spelling words or lines.

schema.title: Synth Language
schema.description: The language to use for all announcements.

schema.title: Uppercase pitch delta
schema.description: Pitch variation as you type or arrow accross capital letters.

schema.title: Global Volume
schema.description: The volume for all announcements.

schema.title: Global voice name
schema.description: The voice name to use by default.

schema.title: Parent config
schema.description: The parent config from which to inherit.

schema.title: Pitch
schema.description: The pitch to use for all types of announcements.

schema.title: Punctuation
schema.description: How much punctuation to announce for all types of announcements.

schema.title: The spell rate delta
